name: Vu 98cm (39 inch) Full HD LED TV
content:
I have purchased the TV on FK as it was on deal, otherwise I would have bought it here itself.
1.Great Display at this price. Pictures look clear and crisp and color balance is good.
2. I have seen TCL, SANYO, Micromax, Philips, Videocon and VU has amazing built with amazingly thin back panel and good quality of Plastic. Remote quality is also decent.
3. The sound is not great on this TV, as the price paid is not much I would just ignore the sound at the moment.
4. As Menu could have been better and while playing movies from USB, if you stop it starts again from start, also to reach a point you need to either forward or remember the lapse time where you left.
5. Most of the ports are in Side which need regular connectivity. 2 USB, 2 HDMI which are well spaces, so that I plug in my Chrome cast and Fire TV at a time.
6. 60 Hz, which is good for this price. Higher refresh rate means more smooth rendering and it fails at few places when I played a Blue ray/4K video with slow camera panning colors overlap, not a big failure at all. No impact on Fast moving scenes and Gaming.
7. Works well with PS3 for smooth game play, CHROMECAST connected without any issues and great picture on full HD rendering
8. The installation took 3 days of time and I am quite disappointed with multiple follow ups
9. 1 Years warranty is good and competitive

10.Great VALUE for MONEY. VU is a good brand and is offering good product at best price.
Final Verdict Go for it, if you are looking for a good picture quality with great sounds and have a Budget constraint
I hope my review was helpful! READ MORE

name: Vu 98cm (39 inch) Full HD LED TV
review title: Weakened by a few critical misses.
content:
It's hooked up as a HDMI-connected monitor, the viewing distance is ~10 feet. For me the budget was critical, and the distance meant the largest available (cheap) 32" PC monitor would still be too small. First the good stuff:

1. The build quality is above average at this price level. The casing doesn't creak and the gaps are uniform and small.

2. The sound quality is usable for basic YouTube and Prime Video. Will not shake the earth, but the vocal quality is intelligible and there is a coaxial output to hook up a receiver or DAC. This reduces the amount of cabling, and provides the option of not using the internal speakers at all. The coaxial is a nice unexpected bonus,

3. Picture quality is above average for internet video, and so it will be for satellite TV as well. The colour is about average but the panel itself is probably very narrow gamut. For broadcast this will probably not be an issue.

4. The price itself is very low. It is well below the price of any other 'branded' TV and the brand itself has been around for a bit,.

5. Flipkart delivery and service was outstanding, a marked improvement from what it was six months ago. Very impressed with the quick turnaround - I doubt a local store purchase would have been as efficient.

Now the bad stuff:

1. The front panel indicator light is way too bright. It actually hurt after ten minutes so I had to tape it over with some foam so I could actually look at the screen.

2. With the screen blanked, there is enough backlight bleed to light a reasonably sized room. The power LED is not really needed once the TV is on - and the black levels are correspondingly poor. This is an issue with almost every IPS display including professional ones, but it's usually not this bad. There are lots of bright areas at the periphery, indicating poor polariser performance.

3. The colour while good enough for broadcast, falls short of a proper 8 bpp target. The internal engine is either not using FRC, or the panel is even lower grade than I initially thought. The gamut is also very narrow, the Red is very far off target and the Green is poor - though better than red. Blue is the only colour that is on target, but part of that may be due to the bluish backlight, which is a feature of almost all cheap TVs. The quality of the LEDs in the backlight is very poor, leading to a gamut tilted towards blue. After calibration the colours came closer to the target but you can't fix inherent panel issues this way.

4. The processing engine in the TV is hyperactive, always trying to sharpen or enhance the image, but it trips over its own tail at times. There is some amount of resampling that makes games respond very poorly, with slow frame transitions in low contrast areas. The panel is touted as 60Hz, which is probably the drive frequency for the backlight. The engine is not capable of over 30Hz internally and the result is a light stutter/blur when moving between areas. I suspect this will be a problem in very fast or dark scenes as well.

5. The weakest part of the TV is the firmware. The software fails to save the user-selected zoom setting, which means you have to manually scale from your display, or live with a bit of overscan at the default 16:9 setting. Broadcast and console users will probably not even notice, but those who have it hooked up to a HTPC will either have to rescale the display resulting in loss of 1:1 pixel mapping, or set the zoom every single power-up. The firmware also offers no options for custom white balance, which would have gone a long way in fixing the TVs off-colour gamut to some extent. Whereas the processing engine and panel cost money - and thus can still be forgiven in a TV at this price, there is no excuse for poor firmware. READ MORE

name: Vu 98cm (39 inch) Full HD LED TV

I have booked TV on 25 Sep 17 for Kanpur U.P. in 18400rs.. delivered on 01 oct 17 at 12 pm packing was extremely good.. and installed on 02 oct 17 at 11 am. I'm satisfied with delivery and installation.. 5/5
Now comes on TV..

Picture quality- 4/5 best in this price.. but not superb.. u ll feel ur self wn u ll see Sony and LG picture quality.
Sound quality- 3/5 VU have too improve here.. Bcoz sound is loud enough for 15x15 room.. but not clear.. ( which my mammy complaining )
Connectivity- 4/5 DTH is working fine.. While connecting with 3.5 MM headphone jack to home theater 5.1 .. humming sound is coming.

Pros..
Everything in this price range is just Wow.. I belong to a small town Kanpur.. where ppl don't go for new brands easily..
Google Cromecast 2 is working superbly ( screen mirroring too )
Bezzels are very thin.. which give to Sony 43W772E look.
Extended warranty is a good deal ( if u have kids in home or used TV more than 4hrs in a day ) I have taken 2 years extended warranty in 1452rs.
Cons..
Sound is not good.. Quality of remote is very cheap.. and TV is lil bit thick..
Go for it guys.. in this price range.. u ll not get this type of best deal. Thank you Flipkart.
If u find this review helpful..than give a thumbs up.. Thank you. READ MORE

name: Vu 98cm (39 inch) Full HD LED TV
content:
I bought this Vu led tv (model no. H40D321) from flipkart on 21.09.2017 and installed on 23.09.17. On 10.1017 , suddenly there was a sound of small burst in the tv and the display went off. Thereafter, i switched off the tv and switched it on again a visible mark on the screen appeared. I lodged a complaint regarding the incident with Vu customer care vide no.133926. On 12
10.17, the engineer visited my residence and i narrated the whole thing to him but he said that u have damaged the display to which i replied that there is not even a single scratch on the screen from outside, if anything was hit on it there would have been some kind of impact mark on the screen. He further said that the display cannot be replaced. I am very disappointed with the customer service. I bought this led tv on 21 september 2017 with high hopes from Vu but customer service is awful. I feel cheated and would never recommend vu led tvs to anyone. I had also used lg samsung led tvs who had better customer service. I would not suggest the customers to buy vu led tvs. So freinds, dont go for cheap rates rather go for brands like lg samsung sony. Utterly disappointed. I bought the led tv on 21 sept 2017 for Rs 18499 but all my money has is wasted as vu customer care has informed me that fault is yours.

Nikhil Dogra READ MORE

name: Vu 98cm (39 inch) Full HD LED TV
review title: Excellent picture quality,  Good sound, Poor USB player
content:
Overall it's an excellent product in this price range. But USB media player has some issue regarding the aspect ratio. So for those who like to watch movies using USB, please note the below issue before buying the same.

There is no option to keep the source aspect ratio while using USB media player. It works fine with videos which are in 16:9 aspect ratio. In most scenarios we can see that source file of movies now a days are in 21:9 (or not in 16:9 exactly) and in these cases the videos looks vertically stretched in order to fit its 16:9 aspect ratio, creating distorted images. There is no option in menu to keep the Source Aspect Ratio, while using USB media player.

In order to update/fix the USB media player bug, I have logged a complaint with VU customer support with Call No. VU145701 dated 08 Nov 2017, but no updates as of now. READ MORE

name: Vu 98cm (39 inch) Full HD LED TV
review title: Very good, but lacks basic audio features.
content:
I am fully satisfied.

Pros:

The display clarity is as good as many other popular brands' TVs.

Cons:

The EQ has only bass and treble. They could have provided other Hz as well.

In some branded TVs, when you connect an external speaker through the 3.5 audio out, you will have the option to choose whether the TV speaker should still sound or should be muted. Because, you don't want to watch TV serial in 5.1 surround speaker, but you will wish to watch your favorite Hollywood movie in it. You cant just keep plug and unplug the audio out every time. (1) It is not easy to reach the plug, (2) It will damage the port. Using this feature, you can just keep the external speaker plugged in all the time, and while watching serial, you can turn on TV speaker and for movies turn on the surround speaker and turn off the TV speaker. Since the slim LED TVs cant accommodate huge speakers, pretty much every TV has very average sound (And no bass whatsoever) and for this reason people tend to go for external speaker. Therefore this feature is a basic need.

I am saddened to see this TV does not have this feature, even many other popular brand TVs don't. I wish VU reads this and provides this basic feature in all the TVs. READ MORE

name: Vu 98cm (39 inch) Full HD LED TV
content:
It's amazing product.. No words to say.. just like anything which will cost you 40k +..

The delivery was late by a day but it's ok as the product was delivered safe.

Jeeves people are just bad as the technition had stolen my TV wall mount as I was using the table mount. My brother was only there at the time of installation and he didn't noticed that the wall mount was missing. But he noticed that he was something in his pocket which was bulging outside.

The next day when I reached home I was amazed by the way the tv looked but after checking the box i find out the wall mount was missing. I called the technition and told him that I haven't seen the wall mount and if it was there during the unboxing. I told him that much polite that he can't say that it wasn't there, but he said that in some cases, the wall mount have been reported missing. So I told him that I should email a complaint to flipkart. I cut the call.

He called me back immediately and said that there is nothing to be complained as VU has given them 30 wall mounts as sometimes it's found missing. I know it was a big lie at the instant he told but I don't tell him anything.

Two days after he give me the wall mount and on the box it's printed that it's for VU 40D321. What a fool he is. He stoled my wall mount and said a big lie and returned my own product.

After all I get it back. It was not a good incident that too from flipkarts authorized service network.

ITS TIME TO RETHINK ABOUT JEEVES FLIPKART. READ MORE

name: Vu 98cm (39 inch) Full HD LED TV
content:
This is an awesome product.. Too good for the price.
One big issue with this product is placement of HDMI ports.. Ports are placed very close to each other at the rear of the panel and also lower frame is very close to Port point. They are difficult to reach and almost can't be used both at a time because of spacing.
My usage is, one HDMI cable and a chrome cast device. Chrome cast device power cable has to be bent so badly, it may break some day.
Port placement is very badly designed, no common sense is used by the design engineers.
Vu should atleast provide a HDMI port extension cable to cover up there bad design part. READ MORE

name: Vu 98cm (39 inch) Full HD LED TV
review title: Excellent at this price. Just go for it !!!
content:
It was a good transition for me from 32" Samsung LED to 39" Vu. To be honest, the first thing that attracted me was the price tag, and topped with the SBI debit card offer this was an offer hard to miss. It was really a deal at Rs 18500. To be safe, I had also purchased a 2 year warranty from Jeeves, just in case :) . Also the reviews from Vu customers prompted to go for it.

The following are my observations after 2 days of use:
PROS:
a. Delivery super fast, and the installation by Jeeves was very professional.
b. Very thin bezel, giving it a sleek and premium look.
c. Colour rendition is top class.
d. Plays all video formats. (Played Avatar bluray rip, and the experience was awesome)
e. Interface very friendly.
f. Build quality is very good - Comparably to Samsung or Sony.

CONS:
a. The HDMI ports seem difficult to access, I have to move the TV to change HDMI cable.
b. Sound is a major disappointment. The max volume is just OK for a medium sized room. Will not be sufficient for a bigger hall. This can be addressed with a speaker system though.
c. Sound clarity could have been improved.

However going by the price tag, the cons can be overlooked. The same size LED from Samsung or Sony would have been priced atleast 35 K or more. So I feel this was a good decision. I hope Vu does not let me down in future ;) READ MORE

name: Vu 98cm (39 inch) Full HD LED TV
review title: Best FHD led TV in INDIA below 20k range !!!!!
content:
Review after 5 days....
I bought Vu 39" FHD led Tv from Flipkart at 18999 in offer.but i missed 10% extra instant discount because of SBI credit card jo mere pas nahi tha.
Anyways i am still happy and satisfied.

- Best part is Picture Quality which is awesome when you watch HD channels from any set top box. and please maintain distance atleast 3 mtr to watch Tv otherwise u will not get that quality which u really want.
(I have Tata Sky HD box, and also suggest u to prefer tatsky HD)
- 2 HDMI & 2 Usb port
- 3.5mm jack for headphone or speaker
- true viewing angle
- Noise cancellation function.
- After 6 hrs continue watching, panel doesn't get heated. thats y i says its worth it.
- Sound is loud but not clear type.(but u can avoid it because almost people using home theatre nowadays)

Finally i say you that dont be late and purchase it if u want any FHD led tv below 20 k. READ MORE
